Woman who fell from the sky. Daughter of the sky-chief falls from the sky, is caught by birds, and lowered to the surface of the water. She becomes the creator.

Devil and God create animals. Wolf created as God's dog. The devil creates goats to destroy things.

God and the devil torment each other with their creations. Devil pesters God with gnats. God makes a fire and safeguards himself; God plagues the devil with fleas devil is unable to find means of protecting himself.
Lucifer causes fall of man.
Satan seduces Adam to sin because he is jealous of him.

Creation of the universe.
Universe created in specified time and order.
Universe created in five periods of time.
Universe created in six days.
Primeval chaos.
Primeval darkness.
Primeval cold.
Creation of universe by creator. The creator is existing before all things.
All things created in pairs (heaven and earth, etc.  )
Creation of heaven, earth, and hell.
Fiat creation. Universe is created at command of creator.
Creator uses particular formula (letters) to create universe.
Druids as creators.
Creation: materialization of creator's thinking. Creator "thinks outward in space"  and thus produces the universe.
World-soul. The universe a manifestation of the creator.
Creation from creator's tears.
Universe from parts of creator's body. Ymir makes the world from his members mountains from bones, cliffs from teeth, heavens from skull, etc.
Universe from parts of man's body.
Universe as offspring of creator. The Sky Father begets various parts of the universe by his various wives.
Universe from creator's masturbation with water, with stone, and with earth.
Universe from copulation of various objects to produce others.
Creation of universe from clam-shell on primeval water by creator.
Creation of universe from clay pot set afloat on primeval waters.
Creation of universe from calabash.
Universe created by various activities of creator.
Universe coughed into being.
Universe created by spitting.
Spontaneous creation of universe.
Spontaneous creation evolutionary type. From primeval chaos gradually arise worlds and life.
Spontaneous encroachment of heavens and earth checked by creator.
Universe from congealed vapor.
Creation from vapor-produced primeval giant. Vapors from half-frozen primeval river origin of giant Ymir, from whom universe is created.
Universe created out of fire world.
Universe created out of ice and mist.
World parents: sky-father and earth-mother as parents of the universe. The sky-father descends upon the earth-mother and begets the world.
Heaven-mother earth-father.
Raising of the sky. Originally the sky is near the earth (usually because of the conjunction of the sky-father and earth-mother). It is raised to its present place.
Heaven and earth originally connected by navel string. Navel string cut.
Why the sky receded upward: it was struck by a woman's pestle.
Raising the sky: striking with broom. Old woman's hump strikes clouds as she sweeps. She strikes at sky with broom and thus raises it.
Deity clothes his father the sky after he has separated him from earth.
After sky is lifted, plants and shrubs begin to grow.
Series of creations. The present universe is the last of a succession of creations.

Pre-existing world of gods above. Such a world is assumed before the real creation of the universe. Though this belief is not explicitly set forth in many mythologies, it seems to be implied in most of the North American Indian systems.
Succession of creations and cataclysms. From the ruins of each earlier creation a new one is raised.
Earlier universe opposite of present. Everything in the earlier world was the reverse of the present world.
New creation shouted away. It is unstable and therefore unsatisfactory.
Other means of creating the universe.
Cosmic egg. The universe brought forth from an egg.
Heaven and earth from egg. They are the two halves of an egg shell. Eros escapes as they are separated.
Creation from duck's eggs. Upper vault from half shell, lower vault from half shell, moonbeams from whites, sunshine from yellows, starlight from motley parts, clouds from dark parts.
Universe from body of slain giant. Ymir.
Primeval woman cut in pieces: houses, etc., made from her body.
Universe from pre-existing rocks. Originally rocks are assumed and everything is made from them.
Creation of universe: genealogical type. A begets B, who begets C, etc. Finally the universe is brought forth in its present form.
Universe from cosmic fowl.
The universe as a whole.
Hierarchy of worlds. A series of worlds, one above the other.

Four world systems.

Sun's night journey. Around or under the earth.
Sun's night journey in golden goblet. Helios'  chariot is conveyed eastward at night in a golden goblet (or bed).
Sun's night journey with reversed face. It returns from west to east by the same way that it came, but it turns its light side to the sky and leaves the earth in darkness.
Sun's night journey: in land of dead.
Sun at night closes doors. In evening goes home and shuts doors and windows.
Sun at night lowers arm. The sun, a man, lies with arm uplifted. The shining comes from his armpits. When his arm is lowered the shining ceases.
Sun bathes in stream of fire at night.
Sun led through stream to cool off heat at night; otherwise might consume earth.
Sun hidden at night because afraid to wander.
Mountain where sun goes through.
Sun at night enters fissure between sky and earth.
Sun sits on back of a male buffalo.
At dawn sun comes to play with the moon.
Sun and moon to remain half their time in underworld.
Sun worships God by night.
Visible sun is the "pet" of real sun.
Sun is man during day.
Boat of the sun.
Chariot of the sun.
Charioteer of the sun. Sun drives his horses and chariot across sky.
Coyote rides with sun.
Pha l  ton. Sun entrusts his chariot to another (his son) and the horses run away. The world is almost burnt up.
Chariot of sun accompanied by angels.
The sun a golden bowl on the rim of which sits a peacock; both bowl and peacock are in a crystal box, which rests on a flying chariot.
Man controls rising and setting of sun.
Sun does not set for a year through power of saint.
Daily course of sun across sky.
Sun and moon make daily tour under direct orders of God.
Wings of sun.
Raising the sun. Originally low, it is raised little by little by conjurors.
Sun originally so hot that it threatens all life.
Sun caught in snare.

Sun-snarer: burnt mantle. A boy is angered because the sun burned his mantle. He makes a snare and catches the sun and delays him so that everything is burning up. A mouse finally gnaws the snare in two.

Sun-snarer: fast sun. The sun goes too fast to dry clothing. The hero snares the sun's legs with a rope as he is climbing up from the underworld. He releases the sun upon the promise to go more slowly.
Sun visits earth in form of black bull, caught by man, thus causing night.
Sun and moon carried through sky by animals. Speed depends upon hour and season.
Sun as king of sky and earth.
Sun sits on throne.
Crown of the sun.
The sun's animals.
Cattle and sheep of the sun. 350 of each (= days and nights of the lunar year).
Horse of the sun.
Slave shoots arrow into leg of sun's horse.
Heat and light of the sun.
Why sunlight is so much stronger than moonlight.
Mortal cannot look at sun since God's name is engraved on it.
Two faces of the sun: fire, directed toward earth; hail, directed toward heaven.
Beams of light are snares with which sun is tied to earth.
Sun dries out earth with its heat.
Sun hides.
Sun hides in cave.
Pursuit of sun by moon.
Moon tied to sun so that when sun sinks moon is dragged up to light earth.
Sun and moon pursued by dark planet in black chariot.
Sun as human being.
Sun and moon as man and woman.
Sun sister and moon brother. Brother visits sister at night. She marks him to identify him. He flees and she follows with flaming brand. She is sun and he the moon.
Sun-brother and moon-sister.
Sun and moon as lovers.
Sun and moon married.
Sun and moon quarrel when sun eats up all their children but two.
Moon kills sun's children.
Moon, sun are sister and brother, wife and husband.
Creator separates sun and moon to prevent birth of more stars.
Sun as woman.
Sun and moon as brothers.
Sun and moon as twin brothers.
Sun and moon brothers: sun clever, moon stupid.
Sun and his brother rise and set alternately.
Sun and moon as sisters, daughters of sky-god.
Children of the sun.
Son of sun so hot no one can hold it.
Children from union with the sun turn into bit of blood in daytime as soon as they are exposed to sun; take human form (shape) again at sunset.
Sun and moon as friends.
Sun's affection for human girl rouses moon's jealousy.
Sun marries woman.
Original moon changed into sun and sun into moon.
Sun cursed by moon.
Human son of sun.
Contest between sun and moon.
Causes of eclipses (sun or moon).
Origin of eclipse of moon.
Eclipse caused by monster devouring sun or moon.
Cause of eclipses: mother's curse laid upon her third son.
Toad causes eclipses of the sun.
Ghosts of the sun's children return to cause eclipse.
Moon's eclipse caused by moon's interfering between attacker and person attacked.
Eclipses caused by animal hiding sun behind his body.
Eclipses from quarrels between moon and sun.
Eclipses when sun smears his face on account of mourning.
Sun hides face in shame: eclipse.
Eclipse as punishment by deity.
Eclipses because sun cannot endure tragic happenings of history.
Partial eclipses because of ailments of sun or moon.
Attributes of sun.
Physical attributes.
Sun and moon are balls of feathers.
Sun a fat woman walking across sky.
Mental powers and disposition of sun.
Religious sun and moon.
Sun endowed with wisdom and passion.
Sun's healing powers.
Sun's power over plants.
Nature and condition of the sun miscellaneous.
Sun at the edge of the sky.
War with the sun.
Each of sun brothers works for a month and plays for the other eleven; were they to work all together, the world would be burned up by the heat.
Reason for variations in seasonal heat of sun.
Why the sun is red.
Sun sets and refuses to rise: must be coaxed back from underworld.
Sun's all-seeing eye.
Sun as caretaker of the poor.
Sun has weapons of iron to repel enemies.
Creation of the moon.
Moon from object (person) thrown into sky.
Moon is water slung into sky.
Chest of sacrificed youth becomes the moon.
Moon as grinder which brings fire out of the sun.

Moon made from shining fragments. A cap is opened and shining things fall out. Children pick them up and put them into a box. At the end of the month the box is full. The full moon shines when all the fragments are gathered together.
Moon from transformed object.
Origin of moon from shell.
Heavenly smith is hammering on the moon.
Family of the moon.
Moon born from first couple.
Mother of the moon: the most distant star in the sky.
Moon younger brother of the sun.
Person transformed to moon.
Nature and condition of the moon.
Man in the moon. A man is said to be seen in the moon. Various explanations are given as to how he came to be there.
Man in moon is person thrown or sent there as punishment.
Man in moon has punishment for burning brush on Sunday.
Man in moon is put there as punishment for cursing God.
Man in moon as punishment for disdainful sacrifice (Cain).
Man in moon banished there for stealing bundle of thorns.
Man in the moon a rabbit (hare, other animal).
Frog in moon.
Man in moon a frog which has jumped into person's face and remains there.
Man in the moon: tarring of the moon. Man sets out to tar the moon and remains with his tar-bucket in the moon.
Man in the moon from scratches or paint.
Man in the moon: moon's face scratched by hare in retaliation for injury to hare.
Man in the moon: dung (ashes) on moon's face smeared there by sun.
Moon wants to marry his sister the sun. She is angered and throws hot ashes on his face.
Mark of her mother's hand to be seen on moon's shoulder.
Mark of tiger's paw on moon.
Moon spots are tattoo marks.
Cotton tree and nettles on moon.
Spots on moon a banyan tree planted there by creator to diminish its light.
Two children in moon with yoke and bucket.
Woman in the moon.
Man in the moon is an old woman busy with her spindle.
Man in moon is a woman threshing corn with a dog by her side.
Goddess in moon with calabash at her side.
Woman in moon's oven seen on clear nights.
Girl with tree carried to moon and is seen there.
Goddess in moon beating tapa beneath tree.
Miscellaneous images on moon.
Rows of palm trees (black spots) on the moon.
Bag in the moon.
Giant in moon.
Particular individual is man in the moon.
Joshua as man in the moon.
Jacob as man in the moon.
Other marks on the moon.
Moon as a person.
Moon as wooer. The moon is enamored of a mortal.
Moon abducts woman.
Moon (man) cohabits with woman.
Moon (goddess, woman) cohabits with mortal man.
Moon married to mortal woman.
Moon married to son of sky-god.
Moon is wife to all twelve brothers of the sun and they have her a month at a time because she ate up her sisters.
Moon and mortal have child.
Moon has house.
Moon as person miscellaneous.
Moon deceives sun.
Moon steals from a garden.
During day moon stays with his mother under the earth.
Moon endowed with wisdom and passion.
Moon kept in box.
Moon buried in pit.
Moon falls into pit but is rescued by man.
Causes of moon's phases.
Moon's phases caused by its being put in box.
Moon's phases caused by watcher's death. Moon is hung in tree and is tended by four men. As one dies it loses a quarter. Later it is united in the lower world.
Moon's waning caused by her sickness.
Sacrifice made to free moon from sickness and allow waxing.
Moon cut in two by sun: hence waxes and wanes.
Moon cut in half.
Moon stolen and divided into quarters.
Moon's phases caused by animals gnawing at edge.
Moon's phases caused by feeding or starving.
Moon's phases as punishment for moon's misdoing.
Moon's waning caused by menstrual period.
Moon as sun's representative at night.
Moon-boat.
Moon-chariot.
Theft of moon. Moon is kept by a monster. It is stolen and brought to earth.
Condition and nature of the moon miscellaneous. For eclipse of the moon see +A737, where both eclipses of the sun and moon are handled.
Moon has wooden weapons, therefore vulnerable.
Sun and moon as divine hero's wedding presents.
Why the moon is pale.
Moon is hare covered with silver, which lives in crystal house with fifteen windows. It rests on a chariot and travels around Mount Meru.
Formerly seven moons.
Moon under direct control of deity.
Planet Mars lies on moon to impart warmth to her lest she freeze the earth.
Creation and condition of the stars.
Stars created by creator.
Star from union of girl with peacock.
Ascent to stars. People or animals ascend to the sky and become stars.
River taken to sky becomes star. Eridanos.
Chariot from heaven takes couple to live with sages in the Great Bear.
Stars as transformed lovers.
Stars as fires in the hearths of ghosts.
Stars are men peering through holes in sky.
Stars thought of as living beings.
Star descends as human being.
Star-husband. Star takes mortal maiden as wife.
Mortal marries star-girl.
Stars from objects thrown into sky.
Stars from arrows shot at sky.
Stars hung by god in heavens to decorate it.
Stars as pieces of the moon.
Stars as children of the moon.
Stars as children of sun eaten by their father. Hence no stars in the day.
Sun eats all his own children except morning star, while moon keeps all her children in hiding.
Stars as children of sun and moon.
Stars as drops of the moon's blood.
Most brilliant stars children of the sun; others are children of the moon.
Stars are transformed spittle of the moon.
Naming the stars. The "Great Star" names the stars.
Origin of constellations.
Stars sing together.
Creation of the stars miscellaneous.
Stars are trees growing on the clouds.
Stars rebel against God.
Stars supervised by angels.
Speaking stars.
Sun gives light to stars.
Origin of particular stars.
Origin of the Great Bear (Ursa Major).
Origin of the Southern Cross. Analogous legends in the southern hemisphere with those of Ursa Major in the northern.
Origin of Orion.
Origin of the Pleiades.
Pleiades a princess and six suitors among whom she could not choose.
Pleiades six repudiated wives. They have been cast out for apparent infidelity.
Pleiades girls who died of grief.
Pleiades seven illegitimate children.
Pleiades from hunters marooned in sky after felling world-tree.
Pleiades as swarm of bees.
Two stars from Great Bear constellation transferred to Pleiades.
Origin of the North Star.
Origin of Hyades.
Origin of constellation Lyra.
Origin of Vega (Alpha Lyrae).
Origin of constellation Scorpio.
Origin of the Milky Way.
Origin of Magellanic Clouds.
Milky Way a hunting party.
Milky Way is the Wild Hunt.
Milky Way as a road.
Milky Way as path of souls (demons).
Milky Way as a river.
Milky Way as a stitched seam in the sky.
Milky Way as milk from breast of a woman.
Milky Way as the sperma of the gods.
Milky Way as path of a bird of passage.
Milky Way is smoke (ashes).
Milky Way as race track.
Abyss at end of Milky Way.
Origin of stars miscellaneous.
Origin of Coal Sack.
Origin of constellation Aquila.
Origin of constellation Argo.
The planets (comets, etc.  )
Planets supervised by angels.
Origin of Venus (planet).
Origin of Morning Star.
Origin of Evening Star.
Origin of Jupiter (planet).
Origin of comets.
Relation of the planets to human life.
Origin of meteors.
Falling stars as pieces of the moon.
Shooting star one that has come down to graze.
Shooting stars spirits coming down to earth to make woman pregnant.
Shooting stars are star-dung.
Shooting stars are unfaithful wives.
The heavenly lights.
Heavenly lights originate from firmament.
Origin of the Rainbow.
Rainbow as bow of deity.
Rainbow as snake.
Rainbow made as bridge by the gods.
Rainbow has three colors.
Rainbow is a transformed king; the lesser rainbow is the king's wife.
Rainbow from gods' emptying their drinking cups.
Rainbow is horse of rain-god.
Rainbow comes out of an anthill.
Rainbow lives in a hole.
Origin of rainbow: transformed butterflies (souls of lovers).
Rainbow as covenant between creator and men.
Origin of the Northern Lights (Aurora Borealis).
Origin of the signs of the zodiac.
Origin of colors at sunrise and sunset.
The earth.
Creation of the earth.
Earth born of Chaos.
China first land to appear in our world.
Primeval water: In the beginning everything is covered with water.
God and Devil fly together over primeval water.
Primeval water to subside in a specified time.
Waters of heaven would engulf earth were it not for firmament.
Earth brought up from bottom of primeval water.
Earth originates from fish brought from bottom of sea. The fish is hacked with knives; hence, mountains.
Earth brought up by three gods.

Earth Diver. From a raft in the primeval sea, the creator sends down animals to try to bring up earth. After a number of animals have failed, one (often the muskrat) succeeds. The earth is made from the bit brought up.
Devil as Earth Diver. Satan dives for earth at instance of God. Succeeds only third time (by use of right formula). He hides the earth under his tongue. It swells, and he must be rescued by God.
Earth from egg from bottom of sea recovered by bird.
Creator sends crow, after creating her, to scout for earth-nucleus.
Raft in primeval sea. Creator is on the raft and there creates the earth.
Earth in form of raft supported by spirits.
Lotus-leaf raft in primeval sea.
Creator rests on tree or stake.
Earth from object thrown on primeval water.
Earth from stone thrown on primeval water.
Earth from sand strewn on primeval water.
Earth from decayed matter on primeval water.
Earth from tree grown in primeval water.
Earth from steam made by fire thrown into primeval water.
Earth scattered in a circuit in four directions on primeval water.
Earth from primeval water mixed with seeds of tobacco.
Earth from lotus seed placed on water.
Earth from egg breaking on primeval water.
Earth from creator's spittle falling on primeval water.
Earth from spittle of primeval potter spreading on surface of water.
Earth from turtle's back. Earth erected on back of a turtle floating in primeval water.
Earth from serpent's head. Earth reared on head of serpent floating in primeval water.
Earth rises from sea.
Stone emerges from primeval water. Devil sits on the stone, which becomes a mountain.
Ocean under this world.
God causes primeval sea to roll back and leave bare all the hills.
Earth let down from sky on to primeval ocean.
Other means of creation of earth.
Earth made of lac.
Earth made by mud shaken from back of primeval boar.
World is transformed mud parrot in golden cage.
Earth made by cups of earth placed on spider's web.
Earth made by transformation of broken ground.
Earth made by first couple dancing on bit of cloth laid on water.
Earth sets like curds.
Earth made by drying up of primeval water.
Earth from worm scratched by creator's nails.
Earth excreted by worm.
Creation of earth by creator.
Earth from body of person (animal).
Earth from body of son of deity.
Earth from giant's body (Ymir).
Earth by sacrifice of son and daughter of first couple.
Earth by murder of first brother and sister.
Earth from the body of murdered child.
Earth from body of slain animal.
Earth from body of divine suicide.
Gods create the earth from their dead victim's blood and bones.
Earth created from Adam's body.
Creation because of creator's lonesomeness. Dissatisfied at being alone in center of primeval water, God creates the earth.
Earth from creator's cuticle.
Earth from nut in devil's mouth. God throws a nut over his left shoulder. The devil catches it in his mouth. The nut grows rapidly and the devil spits it out.
Earth created from snow under divine throne.
Creator prepared earth's nucleus as one would a rice cake.
Creator creates earth piecemeal.
Support of the earth.
World-columns. Four (two, etc.) columns or supports sustain the earth.
The four world-columns fastened immovably by two gods with their mother's hairs.
Four world-cords. Earth is suspended from the sky by cords at four corners.
Four maidens as earth-supports. One is at each of the cardinal points.
Twelve iron pillars steady the earth.
Four earth-nails.
Atlas. A man supports the earth on his shoulders.
Goddess standing on her head supports earth.
Old woman supports earth on her head.
Earth supported on post. The post has an old woman as guardian. When she is hungry the post shakes, causing earthquakes.
Earth supported on cross of wood.
Earth rests on animal's back.
Earth rests on turtle's back.
Earth supported by bull.
Earth supported by fish.
Earth supported by frog.
Earth rests on the horns of a bull who rests upon a fish.
Earth rests on tortoise, serpent, elephant.
Earth rests on elephant's back.
Earth rests on cobra's head.
Earth supported on great boar's tusk.
Earth supported on vast number of birds' legs.
Earth rests on leviathan.
Serpent supports the earth.
Support of the earth miscellaneous.
Earth founded on stone.
Earth rests on God's arm.
Earth supported by prop.
Changes in the earth.
How the earth became oblong. God the Father situated on one side of the earth, the Son on the other.
Making the earth smaller. Earth made too large. God learns from devil by trickery how to make it smaller.
Making the earth larger. Gradually extended during creation.
Doubling size of the earth. Increase of population necessitates change.
Opposite of present. Everything on the earth courses of rivers, height of mountains, human reproduction, etc. are at first the reverse of the present condition.
Hardening of the earth. At first it is soft, but is hardened by sun's rays.
Primeval earth hardened by wind.
Ground, previously all wet, dries up when first woman cuts her little finger and blood drips on ground.
Steadying the earth.
Why earth becomes warm and wet: two huge copper vessels steaming over fire are underneath earth.
Creator's giant servant puts a valley where earth's crust is heavy and a mountain where it is light so as to stabilize it.
Creator's giant servant puts trees to hold earth together where it slipped.
Roots created to hold land firm.
Nature and condition of the earth.
Earth square with four quarters.
Taprobane at eastern end of the world.
Unextinguishable fire at end of earth.
Four streams from four corners of earth.
Four rivers, rising in paradise, water primitive world.
River that flows around the world.
Seven seas encircle the world.
Above and below the earth are great clouds.
Earth wheel-shaped (flat and round).
Navel of the earth. Omphalos, the central point on the earth disc.
Mountain at center of earth.
Well in the midst of earth from which eleven rivers originate.
Midgard Serpent. A serpent surrounds the earth.
The leviathan that surrounds the globe.
Earth-tree. Tree of life or fate.
Stream of paradise from roots of world-tree.
Other streams from roots of earth-tree.
Three wells under the three roots of earth-tree.
Lake of milk by tree of life.
Animals at earth-tree.
Snake at roots of earth-tree.
Hart(s) eating of the earth-tree.
Chattering squirrel in the earth-tree.
Wise eagle in the earth-tree.
Hawk in the earth-tree.
Golden cock in earth-tree.
Earth-tree furnishes health-giving and hunger-satisfying sap.
Zones of earth corresponding to Zodiac.
Topography general considerations.
Topographical features caused by experiences of primitive hero (demigod, deity). Footprints of the gods, thoroughfares of heroes, etc.
Topographical changes or landmarks due to battle between gods.
Natural features because of combat of huge rock columns with each other.
Topographical features of the earth arranged by creator.
Two creators go by different route to establish features of the earth.
Topographical features caused by animals.
Origin of water features general.
Waters created on first day of creation.
Waters created as punishment.
Bodies of water in primitive abyss sink.
Bodies of water remnant of flood.
Waters created by divine twins.
Bodies of water from tears.
Origin of tides.
Tidal wave or surge marks place of death of person.
Tide caused by breathing of sea-monster.
Ebb-tide goes to great whirlpool.
Tub that drips at high tide but holds water at low tide.
Mountains push water westward.
Why waters do not engulf the earth.
Quarrel between earth and waters.
Male and female waters.
Origin of the seas.
Origin of lakes.
Origin of particular lake.
Inexhaustible buckets as source of lakes.
Lakes from digging of primeval ox.
Lake bursts forth to drown thief.
River bursts from well in pursuit.
Lakes burst forth to commemorate birth, death, battle, etc., of primitive hero .
Lakes originate from tears.
Lakes originate from belches.
Lake from urine of horse.
Lake created by fairies.
Lake bursts forth to quell fairy war.
Lake bursts forth to drown impious people.
Lake from violating tabu.
Lake bursts forth where island is plowed out.
Lakes made by giant or devil.
Woman transformed to pool of water.
Lake bursts forth where blind king plucks rushes.
Lake of milk formed through virtue of saint.
Lakes are daughters of the gods.
Origin of the Dead Sea.
Lake originally filled with palm wine.
Origin of sea channels.
Ocean the son of Earth and Heaven.
Ocean made from blood.
Ocean from creator's sweat.
Ocean from urine.
Miscellaneous origins of the ocean.
Origin of sea from overturned calabash.
Origin of sea from rotting snakes.
Sea released from tree-top.
Sea from earth excavation.
Origin of various qualities of the sea.
Origin of high sea waves.
Origin of sea's color.
Origin of foul odor of sea.
Origin of fresh water welling up in sea.
Origin of mournful sound of sea.
Origin of surf.
Origin of shining patches beneath sea.
Giant drinks up ocean.
Origin of streams.
Creator of rivers.
Snake as creator of rivers and lakes.
Meander-pursuit.
River from urine of goddess (giantess).
River from the slaver of the Fenris-wolf.
River from vagina of first woman.
Various origins of rivers.
Rivers from digging of primeval ox.

Rivers formed where certain stones are placed. Each of seven children are to go in a different direction, to walk a mile and put down a stone, then another mile and a stone, etc. Thus rivers are formed.
Rivers burst forth to commemorate birth, death, battle, etc., of primitive hero.
Rivers where god drags his staff.
Rivers originate through saint's prayer during drought.
Hail-storm leaves twelve chief rivers in Ireland.
River bursts from well in pursuit.
Rivers from mythical well.
Stream unexpectedly bursts from side of mountain.
Origin of river: from a girl drowned in a well.
River from transformation.
Girl reincarnated as river so god Vishnu can lie in its bed in the form of a stone.
Person transforms self to river.
Goddess in anger breaks herself into five parts: hence, five branches of a river.
Origin of river: transformed flowing honey.
Peacock shows rivers the way to the big valley so they will not go round and round.
Origin of falls (cataracts).
Why there is no mist on a certain river: fanned away with a pair of eagle's wings.
Rivers and streams offspring of marriage of Ocean and his sister.
Origin of other bodies of water.
Origin of springs.
Origin of a particular spring.
Springs originate from horse's hoof-prints.
Spring from urine of horse.
Spring breaks forth where fairy horse lies down.
Springs originate from tears.
Spring from striking earth with sword.
Spring breaks forth where magic spear strikes ground.
Spring where god throws his staff or spear.
Spring breaks forth to commemorate experiences of hero (deity).
Spring breaks forth to commemorate place of death or burial.
Spring breaks forth at primitive hero's need.
Spring breaks forth at need of demigod's warriors.
Spring breaks forth through power of saint.
Fountain breaks forth through power of Virgin Mary.
Wells break forth at birth of Christ.
Spring breaks forth where saint smites rock.
Many-colored fountain breaks forth where saint strikes earth with his foot.
Spring breaks forth through power of saint at place where leper pulls out clump of rushes.
Spring breaks forth where animal delivers book left behind by saint.
Spring breaks forth where saint's stolen cow is found.
Cloth from goddess, when spread by holy man over a spot, causes water to spring from earth.
Origin of springs where deity dug.
Spring from innocent king's blood.
Breaking forth of springs partial cause of Flood.
Springs from beneath magic (holy) object.
Spring from beneath world-tree.
Spring from roots of sacred tree when arrow is shot into it.
Stream from under holy of holies in temple.
Origin of hot springs (geysers).
Hot springs rise where Christ bathed his feet.
Origin of salt springs.
Origin of the land.
Contours of land caused by plowing of goddess.
River valley licked out by giant beast.
Contours of land caused by rooting of swine.
Contours of land caused by occult hero driving harrow.
Land rises out of sea.
Land thrown down from heaven.
Land born from goddess.
Origin of islands.
Islands created by order of deity.
Islands as deity's stepping-stones.
Island created by shooting arrow.
Origin of island's shape and position.
Origin of an island's shape.
Origin of island's position.
Primeval hero moves islands into their present position.
Island plowed out by goddess.
Islands from cow and calf transformed by evil eye of one-eyed god.
Islands from stones cast by giantess.
Islands from webs woven by primeval spiders.
Island fished-up by demigod (hero).
Goddess gives birth to islands.
Islands from transformed object or person.
Islands originally form continent, later separated.
Old woman as guardian of floating islands of the gods.
Origin of peninsulas.
Origin of desert.
Creation of mountains (hills).
Mountains from primeval animal.
Hills from flapping of primeval bird. Hills and valleys are formed from the flapping of a giant turkey-buzzard when the earth is still plastic.
Mountains from hacked-up fish drawn from bottom of primeval water. Earth originates from a fish drawn from the water. It is hacked up and thus made to form mountains.
Mountain from accident to primeval lizard. Lizard passing through a mountain is broken; his fore and hinder parts become mountains.
Mountains spring from scattered parts of slain giant serpent's body.
Mountains (cliffs) from bones of killed giant.
Mountains (hills) from ancient activities of god (hero).
Mountain from part of deity's (hero's) body.
Mountains made with God's hand.
Mountains from primeval journeys of a god.
Mountains pressed together by God.
Mountains made with the hand.
Mountains originated from primeval journeys of the first man.
Hills from hero's striking (earth) with sword.
Origin of hills and ridges: pieces of shattered god's head.
Mountains and hills are former sons, daughters of gods.
Hills represent loads from culture-hero's shoulders.
Mountains from stones (soil, sand) dropped or thrown.
Mountains from stones dropped from giant's clothes. He carries the stones in his clothes but loses them as he walks.
Mountains from breaking of God's sieve. He is sifting stones and the bottom of the sieve breaks, letting huge stones and mountains fall through.
Soil dropped to form mountains.
Mountains and hills from stones thrown by giant at church.
Hills from stones cast by giants.
Hill from anvil (cast by supernatural smith).
Hill from sand left by passersby.
Hill as unfinished tower built in the likeness of Nimrod's tower.
Clay soil dropped from sky to form hill.
Mountains (hills) from ancient contest (fight).
Holes in hills result of fight between gods.
Mountains fight each other: cause of their present shape.
Mountains fight each other for honor of being the spot for the revelation.
Battle of demons: hills torn up.
Origin of mountain chain.
One mountain in love with another stretches leg out to meet her: origin of a mountain chain.
Origin of volcanoes.
Origin of mounds.
Mounds from horns cast by cattle.
Origin of cliffs.
Cliffs become hard. Were formerly soft but become hard by God's order.
Cliff from lovers' leap. Lovers in despair throw themselves from a high place. This becomes a cliff.
Creation of mountains and hills miscellaneous.
Mountain from buried giant.
Cloud on lofty male mountain induced by a beautiful female mountain to bow to her feet: hence their present shape.
Mountains and valleys formed from great fire.
Hills because sky asked earth to wrinkle up its feet.
Water freezes and forms mountains.
Hill brought to country as adopted child.
Origin of mountains as punishment.
Origin of crevasse.
Mountain or hills from actions of the devil.
Origin of rocks and stones.
Origin of rocks from breaking of God's sieve.
Indentions on rocks from prints left by man (beast).
Indentions on rocks from imprint of gods and saints.
Indentions on rocks from footprints of Christ.
Priest stamps on stone to prove truth of pope; print is still visible.
Footprints of holy man are still seen in stone where he stood to preach.
Indentions on rocks from footprints of fairies (angels, devils).
Indention on rock from footprint of angel.
The devil's footprint.
Holes in stones caused by piercing by saint's finger.
Holes in stone caused by saint (warrior).
Indentions on rock from weapons (limbs) of robbers through power of saint.
Indentions on rocks from footprints of saint's cow.
Imprint of horse in rocks.
Indentions on rocks from marks of various persons.
Indentions on rocks from head of infant hero (saint).
Chasms between rocks mark "leaps" of giants, heroes, etc.
Indentions on rock from paws of King Arthur's dog.
Indentions on rocks from weapons, knees, and elbows (of persons slain by hero).
Rocks or hill-tops flat because persons (gods) slept or cooked on them.
Hole in stone caused by weapon of warrior.
Indentions on rocks caused by giants.
Great fish killed by hero and cut into sixteen pieces: the great stones may still be seen.
Origin of stones: punishment for discourtesy. Jesus asks a man what he is sowing. He answers, "Stones." Jesus turns the crop to stones. This is how stones originate.
Rocks from transformation of people to stone.
Certain stones are druids transformed by power of saint.
Certain stones are transformed giants.
Why stones became hard. By God's order.
Why stones no longer grow. Devil sows stones; God sends cold to prevent their growing.
Why stones no longer grow: punishment for injuring foot of holy person.
Why certain rock produces fire when struck with steel.
Fire producing rock result of contest between god of fire and god of rain.
Why rocks at river are covered with moss.
Origin of particular stones or groups of stones.
Giant responsible for certain stones.
Devil throws stones.
Devil and man throw stones in contest.
The devil throws stones at church or churchmen.
Devil throws down quoits when he is told that it is wrong to play on Sunday. They remain as stones to this day.
Devil drops stones.
The devil drops stones from apron.
The devil turns object or animal to stone which is still seen.
Origin of particular rock.
Certain stones are cheeses transformed by saint.
Pile of stones in certain chapel formed of fragments of salmon transformed by saint.
Stone column is membrum virile of ancient hero.
Two rocks from split and transformed lapdog.
Origin of minerals.
Origin of minerals from body of dead culture hero.
Iron created to punish cedar's pride.
Origin of emeralds from marvelous vase broken into pieces.
Other stories about stone origins.
Stone rent at time of crucifixion.
Origin of particular places.
Origin of valleys or hollows.
Pillars of Hercules at Gibraltar set up by Hercules.
Bridge of the Gods. A conflict of the gods breaks a primeval bridge and thus causes a rapid in a river (the Columbia River at The Dalles, Oregon).
Cairn marks burial place.
Origin of particular places miscellaneous.
Dark brown patches on soil mark place where marvelous cow (Glas) and her calf lay.
Roads marked out by supernatural cows.
Certain stones are druids' (saints') seats (chairs).
Pile of stones (cairn) marks site of battle.
Other land features.
Origin of villages.
Origin of sacred places.
Origin of sacred post (placed there by ancestral culture hero).
Sacred place where thunderbolt fell down.
Ground bursts open and a temple rises from it.
Five great roads of Ireland "discovered" on night of king's birth.
Origin of cities.
Origin of settlements (places later to be settled).
Origin of boundaries.
Origin of clay.
World catastrophe. The world is destroyed. The incidents are usually the same whether a final destruction is thought of or a destruction which may be overcome by a renewal of the earth.
Series of world catastrophes.
Doomsday. Catastrophes precede the Day of Judgment.
Widespread calamity when feast of John the Baptist shall fall on certain day.
Signs before the Day of Judgment.
No rainbow for fifteen years before the Day of Judgment.
Bleeding wood as sign of Doomsday.
Talking stone as sign of Doomsday.
Unusual migration of birds as sign of Doomsday.
Calamity as punishment for sin.
Preservation of life during world calamity.
Preservation of life of certain persons in Ireland during Flood.
Inclosure made during world calamity and only best types of animals and men preserved.
Holy Land not ravaged by deluge.
Renewal of world after world calamity.
New race from single pair (or several) after world calamity.
New race from incest after world calamity.
New race made of red earth after world calamity.
New race from union of girl and rat.
Ireland repopulated by persons who escape flood.
Ireland, waste for centuries after flood, is repopulated by immigrants.
Whole tribe descended from lone woman-survivor of doomed city.
One bear-child escapes death, is ancestor of all bears.
After world-fire life recreated from tree.
World calamity will begin in Palestine.
World catastrophes miscellaneous.
First race of men perishes when sun first rises.
Animate and inanimate objects attempt to destroy humanity.
Large stone falls from sky killing all but one couple.
Deluge. Inundation of whole world or section.
Sun and moon do not shine during deluge.
Great flood lasts eight months.
Local deluges.
Flood partially caused by breaking forth of springs.
Flood caused by rising of river.
God's promise never to destroy world by water does not apply to local floods.
Flood from fluids of the body.
Flood from tears.
Flood from Adam's tears of repentance.
Flood from tears of grieving lover.
Flood from urine.
Flood caused by loosing fairy horse and allowing it to stale.
Flood from blood.
Flood from slain giant's blood.
Flood from belly. It flows from pierced belly of monster.
Vomiting of a whale causes flood.
Flood caused by gods or other superior beings.
Flood from conflict of gods. Sea god and rain god.
Flood from conflict of monsters (giant animals).
Spirit causes deluge.
Flood caused by deity stamping on floor of heavens.
Pseudo-scientific explanations of the flood.
Flood from animals' boring into ground (turtles, crawfishes, etc.).
Deluge produced by hot liquid which burns as it floods.
Flood caused by melting of ice after great spell of cold.
Flood from broken calabashes of water.
Making mountains out of flat earth causes flood.
Moon falls into sea and causes flood by overflowing.
Flood whenever shard at earth's core moves.
Flood caused to satisfy emotional need.
Desire of man for sun causes flood.
Flood caused by prayer.
Flood caused by curse.
Flood as punishment.
Flood as punishment for breaking tabu.
Flood as punishment for incest.
Flood brought as revenge for injury.
Deluge miscellaneous.
Subsidence of earth beneath flood.
Serpent king causes flood by damming rivers.
Flood because earth has become too thickly populated.
Flood puts out world-fire.
Escape from deluge.
Deluge: escape in boat (ark).
Persons excluded from Noah's ark build another ark and sail to Ireland.
Escape from deluge in wooden cask (drum).
Deluge: escape in gourd.
Deluge: escape on floating tree.
Deluge: escape in hollow tree trunk.
Deluge: escape on floating building.
Pairs of animals in ark.
Bird scouts sent out from ark.
Escape from deluge on mountain.
Escape from deluge on tree.
Escape from deluge in cave.
Escape from deluge on island.
Escape from deluge on foot.
Rescue from deluge by fish.
Bringing deluge to end.
Trickster sticks spear in ground and leads water to sea, ending deluge.
Birds fill sea with dirt and overcome flood.
Escape from deluge miscellaneous.
Marvelous tree survives deluge.
(Four) persons who, in four quarters of the world, survived the flood and thus preserved ancient tradition.
Escape from deluge in pot or jar.
Flood: refuge in huge gourds with seven rooms in each.
Escape from deluge in box or basket.
Survivors of flood establish homes.

World-fire. A conflagration destroys the earth. Sometimes (as with the flood legends) the tradition is somewhat local and does not refer to an actual destruction of the whole earth; sometimes the fire marks the end of the world.
Causes of world-fire.
A "flame of fire swifter than a blast of wind" as punishment for the sin of the Irish.
World-fire after theft of fire.
Evil demons set world on fire.
Fall of sun causes world-fire.
All countries burned while the wife of sun god pours fire from a small bowl.
World-fire because of man's arrogance.
Miscellaneous reasons for world-fire.
Quenching the world-fire.
Rain invoked to destroy world-fire.
Creator puts out world-fire with his staff.
Earth recreated after world-fire.
Men hide from world-fire and renew race.
World-fire miscellaneous.
Vulture sent out as scout to see whether earth has cooled from world-fire.
Continuous winter destroys the race. Spoken of as "Fimbulwinter". It ushers in the end of the world.
One pair escapes continuous winter and renews race.
Continuous world-eclipse.
World-eclipse ended by bat making sun smile.
Heavens break up at end of world.
Behavior of stars at end of world.
Stars fall down at end of world.
End of world when stars in one constellation overtake those in another.
Behavior of sun at end of world.
Sun devoured by monster at end of world.
Sun shining at night as sign of Doomsday.
End of world when four (seven) suns appear in sky.
Behavior of moon at end of world.
Moon shining by day as sign of Doomsday.
Seven days silence in whole universe at the end of the world.
End of world when culture hero removes one of the world-props.
Earth-disturbances at end of world.
Earth sinks into sea at end of world.
Earthquakes at the end of the world.
Mountains fall together at end of world.
Water-disturbances at end of world.
Sea makes extraordinary noise and throws out fishes at end of world.
Sea water mixes with fresh water at end of the world.
Continuous drought at end of world.
Sun will lock moon in deep ditch in earth's bottom and will eat up stars at end of world.
Extraordinary wind at end of the world.
Sun thrown on fire: period of darkness, rain.
Flow of molten metal at end of world.

Fettered monster's escape at end of world. Giant, or monster, is fettered in depths of the earth. His movement causes earthquakes. When he succeeds in freeing himself from the fetters and escapes, the world will end.
Birth of monsters as sign at end of world.
Fettering of underground monster.
Underground monster fettered by trick. Is persuaded to try on fetters.
Forging of chain for fettered monster. Smiths hit once in three or four times on the bare anvil. All of these blows go to forging chains for the monster (devil).
Form of fettered monster.
Fettered monster in human form.
Fettered monster as ferocious animal.
Fettered monster as snake.
Fettered monster as dragon.
Fettered monster's captivity.
Monster fettered with sword just out of reach. If he reaches it he will free himself.
Fettered monster's vain attempt to reach sword with man's help. Could he reach it he would escape.
Fettered monster questions visitor. He asks "Are lambs still being produced?" or the like; i.e. is nature still normal? He must remain fettered till he hears that nature's laws no longer hold.
Fettered monster preyed upon by vulture.
Fettered monster kept just out of reach of water. The water is always drunk by vulture as he is ready to take it.
Fettered monster vainly loosens his stake. Each time he loosens it, it is driven in the ground.
Fettered monster's weakened chains renewed by supernatural power. Are almost licked in two by dog but then renewed.
Fettered monster's weakened chains renewed by stroke of a smith.
End of world heralded by coming of Antichrist, a gigantic destructive one-eyed monster.
Signs before the birth of Antichrist.
Battle at end of world. Armageddon.
Horse shall wade in blood at Armageddon.
Battle of the gods at end of world.
Battle of gods and monster at end of world.
Battle of gods and giants at end of world.
Odin battles Fenris Wolf at end of world.
Other gods battle Fenris wolf at end of world.
God battles hound of hell at end of world.
Thor battles Midgard serpent at end of world.
End of world to come at disease and death of snake encircling the world.
God battles Leviathan at end of world.
God conquers Satan at end of world.
Battle of saints with Lucifer at end of world.
Battle of angels with Leviathan and Behemoth at end of world.
Prophecy of defeat in battle as sign of end of the world.
End of the gods.
Monsters kill each other off at end of world.
World calamities and renewals: miscellaneous motifs.
Natural laws inoperative at end of world.
Three horses from dove's egg on last day.
End of world announced by trumpet.
The Messianic Age.
Extraordinary man at end of the world.
World calamities additional motifs.
World destroyed by rain of stones.
World devoured by ogre.
World turned topsy-turvy and eaten by an earthworm.
Establishment of natural order.
The four ages of the world. A development of the present order through four stages or periods, the golden, silver, bronze, and iron ages, or the like.
Golden age. A former age of perfection.
Reign of peace and justice (under certain king).
Even trees could speak in golden age.
Former age: spirits and ogres lived with men, and gods appeared in human guise.
Reversal of nature in former age.
Formerly men plowed and cattle were their masters.
Formerly men ate grass: cattle ate rice and pulse.
Formerly men dumb: birds and animals talked.
Formerly men could go safely beneath the sea.
Why powers of nature work on Sabbath.
Nature transformed by God once in seven years.
Establishment of present order: waters.
Impounded water. Water is kept by monster so that mankind cannot use it. A hero defeats the monster and releases the water. (The monster is sometimes a giant frog.)
God promises never again to destroy world by water.
Why the sea is salt.
Why the sea is salt: because of wrecked salt ship.
Why the sea is salt: magic salt mill. Stolen by sea-captain, who takes it aboard and orders it to grind. It will stop only for its master; ship sinks and mill keeps grinding salt.
Why the sea is salt: heavy rain showers on ashes of wood burnt by primeval fire.
Origin of sea-waves.
Sea-waves are (manes of) sea-god's horses.
Origin of foam on waters.
Origin of swirling motion of water. Animals and birds scratch in it.
Establishment of present order: waters miscellaneous.
Why sea is blue.
Why sea waters are warm: kept so by Leviathan.
Origin of sea's unpleasant odor.
Establishment of present order: winds.
Breathing of deity (spirit) causes winds.
Cave of winds. Winds originally confined in caves.
Hole of winds: stopper destroyed. The hole is stopped with a wooden stopper, which is destroyed. The country dries up.
Wind a bird dwelling in mountain-hole.
Lost wind found in hollow tree: has been banished and is needed by men.
Wind comes through holes in sky when gut covering is cut.
Winds as children of titans (giants).
Winds caused by flapping wings. A giant bird causes the wind with his wings. The wings are cut by the culture hero so that the bird cannot flap so hard.
Wind caused by flapping of ears of giant.
Wind caused by wind-god's movements. When the son of the wind lies down, the wind blows.
Winds of the four quarters established.
Effect of the four winds on weather.
North wind tempers fury of south wind.
South wind causes heat and hurricanes.
Gentle west wind said to be exhausted from fleeing deity.
Regulation of winds.
Angels' wings protect earth from winds.
When wind-spirit is awake it storms; asleep, it is calm.
Establishment of present order: winds miscellaneous.
Colors of winds.
Creator establishes twelve winds, each a different color.
Origin of monsoon: from chewed skin and spit of pair of divine friends eating guavas.
Wind is blind.
Establishment of present order: weather phenomena.
Angels set over clouds, winds, and rains.
Origin of storms in sixth heaven.
Origin of rain.
Regulation of rains.
Why it rains most in the hills.
Rain from tears.
Rain from urine.
Rainy weather sent by saint as punishment.
Rain from sea in upper world.
Rain from container in sky.
Rain kept in waterskin dragged along sky floor.
Rain from rain-god (rain spirit).
Rain shed by stars.
Origin of dew.
Origin of clouds.
Origin of clouds from Ymir's brain.
Origin of clouds: creator ornaments the sky with clouds so that the mountains are sometimes shaded.
Clouds as smoke rising to sky.
Clouds as God's shield.
Origin of mist (fog).
Origin of wintry weather.
Origin of cold in winter.
Origin of cold: sun turns fiery face upward.
Origin of snow.
Snow from feathers or clothes of a witch (Frau Holle).
Origin of frost.
Origin of hail.
Causes of hot weather: God bores hole in hell.
Origin of lightning.
Lightning as fiery snake.
Lightning from flashing sword.
Lightning from heavenly horses striking hoofs against stars.
Lightning as god's whip.
Lightning as God's messenger.
Lightning produced by deity.
Lightning from fire.
Lightning as torches of invisible dancers.
Origin of lightning other motifs.
Origin of thunder.
Origin of thunderbolt.
Creator's (deity's) voice makes thunder.
Thunder from flying dragon.
Persons escape to sky and become thunder.
Origin of thunder clouds: from wings of mountains.
Thunder is sound of God's gun.
Thunder caused by God beating his weapon.
Thunder from crashing of stones in moon as goddess beats tapa.
Thunder from thunder-spirit beating his children.
Cause of thunder: sounds of the horses' hoofs as gods play ball.
Thunder from clashing weapons of warring spirits in sky.
Thunder from deity separating the winds which try to unite.
Thunder is noise of waterskin which rain-god drags along sky floor.
Thunder made by giants in sky.
Thunder the drums of dead.
Cause of earthquakes.
Earthquakes from movements of subterranean monster.
Earthquakes from movements of sea-monster.
Origin of stormy sky.
Origin of red sky (blood).
Origin of tornado sunsets; i.e., peculiar sunsets foreboding tornadoes.
Determination of seasons.
Establishment of times for sowing and reaping.
Theft of the seasons. Certain seasons are lacking. A culture hero steals the season from a monster and brings it to his people.
Boneless man turned over to produce seasons.
Seasons produced by marriage of North and South.
Genealogy of summer and winter.
Why days lengthen in spring.
Why days shorten in autumn: the real sun sets very early because the red cockscomb plant, used to kill his brother sun with, grows to its full height during this time.
Causes of seasons deities push sun back and forth at solstices.
Determination of the months.
February's shortage of days. Days stolen by January and March.
Origin of night and day.
Origin of day.
Opening of creator's eyes creates day.
Windows in firmament shed light.
Angels of the day:  Jewish: Neuman.
Origin of day: son of the night and the dawn.
Determination of night and day. After much discussion, the relative length of these divisions is determined.
Regulation of sunshine.
Wallet containing night and day.
Night and day have steeds and chase each other.
Origin of night.
Night (darkness) in package. Released.
Why some nights are dark and some light.
Purchase of night. Originally no night. Culture hero goes to distant land and buys it. He introduces sleep, etc. Cock to crow for day.
Night stolen and kept in jar.
Night caused by deity wrapping himself in dark mantle.
Why sun shines on Saturday (Friday).
Origin of "yesterday" and "today."
Origin of night and day miscellaneous.
Origin of twilight.
Twilight reflection of fires of hell.
Origin of dawn.
Dawn reflection of roses of paradise.
Establishment of present order miscellaneous motifs.
Determination of world center. By reaching to its ends.
Determination of world quarters. The four cardinal points.
Wings cut from flying mountains. In beginning mountains have wings. They are cut off by thunderbolt.
Measuring the world.
Creator appoints a chief for each class of created things: Lucifer for demons, Sion for mountains, etc.
All things receive names.
Origin of echo.
Why salt disappeared from forests.
Creation of man.
Man created to rule the earth.
Unacceptable gods as first inhabitants of earth.
Creation of man by creator.
Man made from creator's body.
Man springs into existence from deity's body by his mere thinking.
Man from dirt mixed with creator's blood.
Man from sweat of creator.
Man from spittle of creator.
Being made from spittle of the gods.
Man made from creator's eye.
Man made from dirt rubbed from creator's (hero's) body.
Man made from broken off toenail of creator.
Primeval human pair spring from two drops of urine of creator (woman from half-drop).
First man the result of maid having licked semen-stained loin cloth of creator's teacher.
Primeval crab pulls first five living creatures out of his side.
Man created in creator's image.
Man originates from god who comes to earth.
Man as offspring of creator.
Mankind from masturbation of creator with earth.
Devil's unsuccessful attempt to vivify his creations as God has done. Succeeds only in making animal.
Rebel angels oppose creation of man.
Man created by co-operation of the gods.
Creation of man through evolution.
Progressive degeneration to present race of men.
Mankind from unusual primeval mating.
Mankind begotten by giant's two feet. He touches one foot with the other and begets progeny.
Mankind from "Peace and Quiet fructified by Light."
Mankind from mating of pairs of reeds.
Mankind from mating of tree and vine.
Mankind from mating of frog and "daughter of fire."
Mankind from human-animal mating.
Mankind originates from eggs.
Descent of man from animals.
Mankind is descended from marriage of human being and animal.
Mankind descended from tadpoles.
Mankind descended from worms or larvae.
Woman created from dog's tail. Eve.
Mankind born from a cow.
Descent of men from monkeys.
Men are monkeys who have lost their tails.
Mankind descended from fish.
Creation of man by creator from ants. He commands them to become men.
First men undeveloped. Rudimentary and amorphous, gradually assume present shape.
First couple organically united. Like Siamese twins.
Man originally without hands and feet. Boy steals them from Python, and afterward men have them.
Man given hands, feet, mouth and nose by monkey.
Man created after series of unsuccessful experiments.
Creator makes man out of butter first; it would not stand up and melted.
Different types of men produced from one original type.
Emergence or descent of first man to earth.
First man descends from sky.
Mankind from featherless bird sent from sky.
Mankind ascends from under the earth.
Mankind from bones of dead brought from underworld.
Mankind emerges from lake. A woman and boy. They marry and populate earth.
Mankind emerges from water.
Mankind emerges from caves.
Mankind emerges from a pit.
Mankind emerges from ground.
Earth as virgin mother of Adam.
Primeval human pair spring from womb of Mother Earth.
Mankind emerges from mountain.
Spontaneous generation. Scientists find child on deserted island. They suggest that he has emerged from the ground.
Earth gives birth to woman.
Mankind emerges from tree.
Mankind emerges from buds on trees.
Tribes emerge from melon.
Man made from mineral substance.
Man made from clay (earth).
Man made from piece of clay thrown on ground.
Man made from sand sprinkled with water.
Man made from clay image and vivified.
Man made from earth reddened with blood of human sacrifice.
Man from clay and animal's blood.
Man made of earth brought from four different places.
Man created from stones.
New race from stones thrown over head after deluge.
Mankind from vivified stone image.
Mankind from cleft rock.
Mankind from salty stone (ice block) licked by cow. (Audhumla).
Man born from mountains.
Mankind originates from shell.
Mankind originates from metals.
Man made from vegetable substance.
Creation of man from tree.
Creation of man from wood.
Mankind from vivified wooden image.
Creation of man from fruit (nut).
Creation of man from fruit.
Creation of man from fig.
First man born from apple.
Creation of man from nut.
Creation of woman from coconut. The first man throws a coconut on the ground and thus creates the first woman.
Men from long nuts, women from short ones.
Man created from seeds.
New race from seeds thrown over head after deluge.
Man made from plant.
Man from sugar-cane stalks.
Man from ears of corn.
Man made from herb.
Man made from grass.
Mankind made from miscellaneous materials.
Man made from combination of different objects.
Man made of four elements.
Man made of substances from eight different sources.

Adam's body made of eight (four) things. Body, earth; bones, stones; veins, roots; blood, water; hair, grass; thoughts, wind; spirit, clouds or warmth, fire; cold, air; dryness, earth; instability, water.
Seven substances employed in composition of human body.
Man made of clay with bones of stone, with blood of water and with vines for veins.
Man made from water.
Man created from sea-foam.
Man created from egg formed from sea-foam.
Man created from sweat.
Man created from sweat, heat, and breath.
Man created from part of body.
Man created from blood.
Man created from blood-clot.
Man from blood of game animal.
Man created from fingernail.
Man created from rubbings of skin.
Man created from spittle of holy person.
Man created from animal horns that bloomed and bore him as fruit.
Man created from culture hero's genitals.
Man created from animal bone.
Men created from sown dragon's teeth.
Man created from food.
Man made from meat-ball.
Man created from ashes (cinders).
Tribe born from fire.
Primeval human pair.
Primeval human pair live in innocence.
Origin of first parents.

Sun, moon, and stars bring forth first parents. Sun and moon beget son; morning and evening star beget daughter; these, the first parents, are at first without understanding, but it is awakened later by demigods.
Sun and moon beget stones and birds: these transformed to first parents. Baining of New Britain: Dixon 110.
First parents children of god.
First parents originate from gold which is from body of first man. Born fifteen years old.
Twin first parents.
Incestuous first parents.
Creation of first man's (woman's) mate.
Creation of first woman from man's rib.
Deity creates princess from prince's body and gives her to him.
First man split in two to form mate.
Of ten original men one magically changes sex.
Creator makes woman and then begets man by her.
Man creates a woman from melted butter, sour milk, sour cream and curds offered on the waters.
First woman's mate made from transformed tree.
First man created from nothing wanders until he finds mate.
Why Eve was not made at first along with Adam.
First man descends on earth, falls in love with and marries a fairy.
First created man catches woman in his snare.
Man chosen as best gift by primeval women. In beginning only women on earth. Deity kills one by accident and promises anything as reparation. They choose man.
Offspring of first parents.
First parents devour offspring.
Primeval human pair allowed to bear all children they wish.
Son of first human couple murdered by tiger sent by god; his head becomes the sun, his chest the moon, and his blood gives the red earth its color.
First man and woman bring in children and clothe them.
Primeval human pair miscellaneous.
Of first parents husband so hideous he is kept hidden.
First man (woman).
Condition of first man (woman).
First man covered with horny substance.
Man at first covered with hair.
Change of animal and human skin in ancient times.
Man at first naked.
Men originally self-luminous.
First man created circumcised.
Adam at first nameless.
Adam's name composed of initial letters of four stars from the four quarters of the heavens.
The mother of men.
Mother of the world gives birth to three sons.
Activities of first man.
First man made chief over whole world.
In response to Adam's prayer, God sends him to earth to be father of mankind.
Creation of man other motifs.
Man created by supernatural creature, not deity.
Man created by angels.
Devil in God's absence puts sickness in Adam's body.
Creation in covered vessel. Men (or animals) created in a basket or from a bundle, or from under a blanket.
Multiplication of man by fragmentation.
First human being killed by jealous brothers (reptiles and insects).
Ordering of human life.
Men at first as large as giants.
Arrangement of man's bodily attributes.
Change in bodily form at fall of man. Adam's body was formerly horn-like.
Assembling the body.
Why men are clothed in skin.
Why women have marks on the belly.
Origin of hands and feet.
The lizard hand. Man's hand is modeled on that of the lizard.
Why God changed right hand into left. Man loses hand with which he gives devil a box on ears.
Origin of fingernails.
Origin of human skeleton.
Origin of knee-caps. A stone that magically joins self to woman's body.
Why an uneven number of ribs.
Origin of sex-organs.
Origin of eunuchs.
Origin of sex differentiations.
Origin of male sex-organs.
Origin of female sex-organs.
Origin of clitoris.
Misplaced genitalia. Originally genitals are misplaced. They are properly arranged by the culture hero.

Men and animals readjust span of life. At first, thirty years are given to all animals and to man. For the animals it is too long, for man too short. Man is given a portion of animals' lives. Years 1 30 vigorous (man's own); 30 48 burdens and blows (ass's); 48 60 no teeth (dog's); 60 70 foolish (monkey's).
